subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Sikh Gurus: Ten Teachers, One Message
description: A quick, practical guide to The Sikh Gurus: Ten Teachers, One Message.

hook.text: Ten gurus over 200 years built a religion. The last one said: no more human gurus. The holy book is your teacher now.

buildup.text: From Guru Nanak (1469) to Guru Gobind Singh (1708), each guru added to Sikh teachings and faced persecution bravely.

discovery.text: Guru Gobind Singh created the Khalsa â€” a warrior community bound by discipline, equality, and visible identity.

twist.text: He then declared the Guru Granth Sahib â€” the holy book â€” as the eternal guru. No human could claim that authority.

climax.text: Sikhism's decision to end human gurus was radical. It prevented cult of personality and kept the faith text-centered.

punchline.text: No more human gurus. Sikhism gave final authority to its sacred text.
